translation.en: Amanda?
What're you doing?
Well, I couldn't sleep.
And it has been such a hellish year for us as you know,
translation.ko: 우리 둘 다 올해 정말 힘들었잖아

translation.en: and I just seem to be working every day without even realizing it.
translation.ko: 난 일년 내내 쉴 새 없이 일했고

translation.en: And you are just constantly anxious about your job
because of all the budget cuts. So, I went online this morning
and I rented us a beautiful house out by the beach.
And it was such a steal even though it's barely the off-season.
translation.ko: 비수기인 걸 감안해도 렌트비가 엄청 싸

translation.en: -[bag zipping shut] -Wait, are… are you packing?
Yeah. I thought I'd get a jump on it.
Wait. I don't understand.
When did you rent a house for?
Today.
I figured if I made the reservation and packed our bags,
translation.ko: 일단 예약해놓고 짐 싸두면 안 간다고 못 할 거 아냐

translation.en: it would eliminate most of the reasons to say no.
translation.ko: 짐 싸두면 안 간다고 못 할 거 아냐

translation.en: Oh, and I printed out the little thingy there for you from the website.
It's right by your coffee, made it just the way you like it.
I didn't want to wake the kids so I haven't packed for them yet.
But honestly, I think they're going to be super psyched about this.
translation.ko: 놀러 간다고 하면 신나서 난리 날걸?

translation.en: Well, you know me, I'm always down for a little vacay.
translation.ko: 사실 나도 휴가 가는 건 언제나 찬성이지

translation.en: Especially with the kids. We haven't done that in a while.
translation.ko: 더구나 애들이랑 가본 지는 꽤 오래됐잖아

translation.en: But help me out here, babe. I mean… [chuckles] …why today?
translation.ko: 근데 왜 굳이 오늘 가야 되는데?

translation.en: Well, when I couldn't fall back asleep this morning, I came over here.
translation.ko: 새벽에 잠이 안 오길래 여기 서서

translation.en: To watch the sunrise.
And I saw all these people starting their day
translation.ko: 사람들이 새벽부터 억척스럽게 살아가는 모습이 보이더라고

translation.en: with such tenacity. Such verve.
All in an effort to…
…make something of themselves.
Make something of our world.
I felt so lucky to be a part of that.
But then, I remembered…
…what the world is actually like.
And I came to a more accurate realization.
translation.ko: 그리고 더 명확한 사실을 깨닫게 됐지

translation.en: I fucking hate people.
♪ Bitch, I'm really really out for blood this time, look (no, really) ♪
"Leave the world behind." That's what it said on the rental listing, at least.
[woman on phone] How fun. East Hampton, right?
No, no. It's a cute little town. Actually, I think they call it a "hamlet." That's how cute it is.
translation.ko: 아니, 귀엽고 작은 마을이래 오붓한 촌동네인가 봐

translation.en: It's a lot closer to the city and still very far away from, well, everyone.
[woman on phone] Ugh, sounds exactly like what you need right now.
After you answer some questions about the Confictura account?
Please? Pretty please?
Did you fart?
[man] Archie, let her be.
Well, no, Dad, I don't care that she farted. I-I care that she lies about it.
translation.ko: 방귀 뀐 건 괜찮은데 아닌 척하잖아요

translation.en: We're throwing Phoebe a bachelorette party.
Yeah. Sorry, boys. This ride's closing.
[Amanda] Yeah okay. Okay sure.
Dad, when we get back to the city,
can you take me to see the coffee shop in Friends?
I don't think that's real, honey. It's, uh, just a set.
translation.ko: 그 커피숍 실제론 없을걸? 세트일 거야

translation.en: ♪ Is that the goal? ♪
Race you to the pool.
♪ Won't you be for real? ♪ -♪ Misled ♪ -[kids laughing] ♪ Misled ♪ ♪ Misled ♪
Oh, this is nice.
It's beautiful.
Looks like we have some top-shelf booze right here.
[Amanda] It says here it's not for us.
Hmm. Worth a try.
The Wi-Fi password is a novella.
The owner must be one of those cybersecurity guys.
translation.ko: 집주인이 사이버 보안 쪽 일을 하나?

translation.en: The kids look so happy.
I'll get the stuff from the car.
Uh, when you're done, I might pop into town for some groceries.
translation.ko: 짐 다 내리면 시내 가서 장 좀 봐 올게

translation.en: [announcer on television] Trying to make it a three-hit day.
And keep this one going.
They're not mine. I swear. They're not mine.
Relax. I bought them.
I know you like to sneak a smoke here and there.
I figured we're on vacation. Why not?
I want you to have a good time. Just don't let the kids see you.
Okay. Oh, hey, hey.
I got another idea for a good time. Hm?
M-Maybe?
[Amanda] We've got 15 minutes before they're begging to go to the beach.
That's all I need.
Sunblock? Sunblock?
-Yep, yep, yep. -Yeah.
We practically have the beach to ourselves.
[girl] Look at that boat.
It's so big.
Hey, Mom, Taylor just dropped a pin.
Can you, uh, can you look at that and see how far her house is?
Just look. Y-You said maybe we could drive over there. -Right? So, maybe? -Mm-hmm.
translation.ko: 한번 좀 봐줘요 가까우면 들르기로 했잖아요

translation.en: All right, that's Sag Harbor. That's at least an hour away, honey.
translation.ko: 새그 하버네 그럼 한 시간은 걸려

translation.en: It's getting closer.
-What is? -The ship.
Oh, yeah. She's a beaut. Looks like an oil tanker.
Must be a port around here. I read this piece in The Atlantic
translation.ko: 여기 항구가 있나 봐 기사에서 봤는데

translation.en: that says New York has one of the largest natural harbors on the planet.
translation.ko: 뉴욕주엔 세계 최대의 천연 항구가 있대

translation.en: You okay, Rose?
I think that ship is heading towards us.
What was that, sweetie?
-Clay? -Hmm?
-Clay. -Yeah.
Wow. It's getting close, huh?
You think that's a problem?
Nah, come on. It's gonna stop. It's got to.
Right?
Wake up. Archie, come on, bud. Help us pack up.
Leaving already? Why?
-[boat rumbling] -Holy fuck.
Jesus, Archie, let's go.
-Let's go! Go, go, go! -[beachgoers screaming]
Come on, keep it moving. Keep it moving, guys.
Excuse me, officer. Do you know what happened?
There's been a handful of these groundings up the coast,
something to do with the nav system. Sorry guys, I need you to keep it moving.
Keep it moving, guys.
There's a Starbucks.
I wanted to read up on what happened at the beach but the Wi-Fi isn't working.
translation.ko: 그 사건 기사를 보고 싶은데 와이파이가 안 돼

translation.en: You think the router needs a reset?
Well, sorry, I can't help you there. You are the tech wiz, not I.
You know, the TV's out too. I tried to check the game but there's no signal.
translation.ko: TV도 말썽이야, 경기를 보고 싶은데 수신이 안 돼

translation.en: You still gonna be down for burgers tonight?
Yeah, I could be down for that.
Meanwhile, the kids seem to have completely gotten over it
translation.ko: 애들은 그새 그 일을 까맣게 잊었나 봐

translation.en: like it was something they saw on a show.
They're on to the next episode.
[whispering] Clay.
Come here, look.
[whispering] Oh, wow.
That's a good omen. Seeing deer.
At least according to Mesoamerican mythology.
You gonna help? Hmm?
Uh, wha-- Yes. Yes, I'm here to help.
-[Clay] Don't, don't do it that way. -[Amanda] No, no, no, no, no. Well… -Don't, don't go in the middle. -No, I'm gonna go in the middle.
translation.ko: - 가운데 거 빼지 마 - 싫어, 가운데 거 뺄래

translation.en: Because it'll make it harder for you. And isn't that the point of my life?
translation.ko: 당신을 괴롭히는 게 내 삶의 기쁨이잖아

translation.en: You getting some more? Would you top me up?
translation.ko: 더 마시게? 나도 한 잔 줘

translation.en: Sure, but I think I'm donezo. I need a glass of water,
or I'm going to have a motherfucker of a hangover tomorrow.
translation.ko: 내일 숙취가 장난 아닐 거 같아

translation.en: Hey, you remember that student of mine who was published last year? Maria Miller?
translation.ko: 작년에 책을 낸 내 제자 마리아 밀러 알지?

translation.en: Well, she wants me to write the foreword to her second book.
translation.ko: 걔가 두 번째 책의 서문을 써달래

translation.en: I mean, you know, she says I'm some kind of huge inspiration.
translation.ko: 내가 책 쓰는 데 큰 영감을 줬다나?

translation.en: I never know if I'm even getting through to these kids
-and then something like this happens… -[thud]
-Did you hear that? -Mm-mm.
Her second book is like an exploration
translation.ko: 두 번째 책의 주제는 이런 거야

translation.en: of how media serves as both an escape and a reflection.
Which is a contradiction -that she manages to reconcile. -[thud]
[whispering] Someone's here.
Get a bat.
-A bat? -Yeah.
Why would I have a bat?
[man] I'm sorry. Hello?
I'm sure it's nothing. Let me take care of it.
Actually, you know what? Get your cell phone.
Just, you know, just in case.
I'm so sorry to bother you.
Hello. Hi.
-I'm so sorry to bother you. -In case you didn't know. [chuckles]
[chuckles] Well, can I help you?
I know it's late. A knock at the door, way out here.
Couldn't decide if we should knock at the front door or the side door,
and this went on for some time.
I thought we should try the side door because it has glass
and you'd have seen us and known we're just…
You must be Amanda.
A-Amanda Sandford, right?
You, you two know each other?
No, we have not had the pleasure of meeting face-to-face.
I'm- I'm G.H. G.H. Scott.
George. He's George. That's how it reads in his email.
Oh. [chuckles] Forgive me. I forgot.
See, this is why I much preferred life before the internet,
translation.ko: 이래서 전 인터넷 없던 때가 좋아요

translation.en: because we would have spoken on the phone, you would have recognized my voice
and known that this is our house.
I'm sorry?
This is our house. I'm the George you emailed back and forth with.
translation.ko: 여긴 저희 집이고 전 부인과 이메일을 주고 받은 조지입니다

translation.en: No, I-I remember the name, I just…
This is… this is your house?
I'm sorry. You think we could come inside?
Oh, yeah. Hey, sure. Y-Yeah, come, come on in.
Yeah. Got cold out all of a sudden.
I understand how strange this must be for you. Us, turning up like this unannounced.
We would have called, you see, but, uh… the phones are out.
translation.ko: 전화를 드리고 싶었지만 폰이 안 돼서요

translation.en: Yeah, my phone doesn't seem to have service.
translation.ko: 네 제 폰도 지금 안 되네요

translation.en: It's almost as if we're telling the truth.
[chuckles] Hey. I'm Clay.
-Ruth. -Hi.
-And I'm G.H., again. -G.H.
-Clay, nice to meet you. -Yeah.
Why don't we… sit down?
And you know, talk.
The children are sleeping.
I wouldn't worry too much about them. I mean, Archie'd sleep through the atom bomb.
You know? [laughs] Let's go in the kitchen.
[G.H.] Tonight we were at the symphony in the Bronx. Have you been?
[Clay] Uh… No.
[G.H.] Their productions are in a class of their own.
[Ruth] He's on the board of the Philharmonic.
He likes to encourage everyone he knows to take an interest in classical music.
translation.ko: 주변에 늘 클래식 음악을 홍보하고 다니시죠

translation.en: So in other words, I am one lucky daughter.
Do you mind if I get a glass of water?
Uh, no, no. Uh, help yourself.
[G.H.] Anyway, we were driving back to the city, home.
And then something happened.
A blackout.
-A blackout? -[G.H.] Mm.
The lights seem, seem to be working pretty good.
Exactly, right, so, um… we thought…
Well, with everything that's probably going on in the city right now, we didn't--
translation.ko: 시내는 모든 게 올스톱인 데다 저희 아파트는…

translation.en: We live on the 14th floor and he can't climb 14 flights because of his knee.
Plus the traffic lights went out.
We would have been sitting in a six hour parking lot if we'd headed home.
translation.ko: 그쪽으로 갔으면 몇 시간 동안 길에 갇혔을 거예요

translation.en: So there was a blackout and you decided to drive all the way out here?
translation.ko: 정전 때문에 이 먼 데까지 오셨다는 거예요?

translation.en: These roads, they're familiar. I barely even thought about it.
translation.ko: 워낙 이쪽 길이 익숙해서 정전이 된 순간

translation.en: So when we saw the lights go, I looked at Ruth--
And said that he would feel better if we stayed here.
You know, in his house. [slurps]
Wait. Y-You, you want to stay here? But… we're staying here.
translation.ko: 여기서 묵으신다고요? 여긴 저희가 묵고 있는데요

translation.en: Well, under the circumstances, we, we thought you might understand.
-Of course. Yeah. It's just-- -Uh…
I think what he means is, of course we understand--
I know it's a surprise, but we thought maybe if you let us stay--
Because, again…
You know, it is like…
-our house. -[awkward chuckle]
What she's trying to say is we wanted to be somewhere safe.
translation.ko: 얘 말은 안전한 데서 묵고 싶다는 겁니다

translation.en: Well, you know, we're, we're on vacation.
Clay, Amanda, we could absolutely refund you your money.
You want us to leave?
I-It's the middle of the night. My, my children are sleeping upstairs.
You come in here and talk about refunding our money.
I-I think I need to call the company. I don't even think you can do this.
Um, there's got to be a number on their web--
Th-That's really not necessary.
Why not?
Because we're not saying you should leave.
We could refund you, say, 50% of what you paid.
You know, there's an in-law suite. We could stay downstairs.
Downstairs?
Fifty percent?
I think we need to look at the terms and conditions here. Uh…
A-All right, we need to find the, the Wi-Fi router.
-Okay, I'll try tethering it to my cell. -It needs to be reset.
All right, well, the phones aren't working, Clay. How's that supposed to make a difference?
translation.ko: 폰이 아예 안 되는데 연결해서 뭐 해?

translation.en: I think the internet is down anyway, so--
Okay, look. I'm… [sighs] I'm sorry.
I just, uh, I don't feel comfortable staying in a house with…
translation.ko: 전 모르는 분들과 한집에서 지내는 게

translation.en: …people I don't know.
Uh, it's a blackout. I-It could be over in a couple of hours.
May I?
I should have listened to my wife and had these labeled already.
Ah… Here we are.
Yeah… I can give you a thousand dollars now for the night.
translation.ko: 하룻밤 묵는 값으로 천 달러 드리죠

translation.en: That should cover almost half of what you're paying for the weekend.
translation.ko: 지불하신 주말 렌트비의 절반쯤 될 겁니다

translation.en: It's a thousand dollars.
We'll be very grateful.
Then tomorrow, we'll know a little more and… -…we'll figure this all out. -Yeah.
translation.ko: 내일 상황이 파악되면 방법을 또 찾아보죠

translation.en: Meanwhile this thing is not responding.
So anyway, I say one night, it's like--
I think we should discuss this privately.
You know, we're gonna go talk in the other room, all right?
translation.ko: 딴 방에 가서 얘기 좀 할게요

translation.en: -Say, you mind if I made myself a drink? -Oh, sure. Make yourself right at-- Um.
translation.ko: - 술 한 잔 마셔도 되죠? - 네, 얼마든지…

translation.en: Yep.
[Amanda] Why did, why did you tell them they could stay? [Clay] I mean, it's a blackout.
What, you, y-you think they're lying?
I mean, it's a young woman and her father, they look innocent enough.
They're strangers.
They introduced themselves.
They knocked on the door in the middle of the night.
Would you rather them burst in?
They scared the shit out of me.
Well, I think, you know, that they were scared too.
Right? I mean, they didn't know what else to do.
Well, here's an idea: go to a hotel.
This is their home as, you know, the girl kept reminding us.
Well, we didn't ask for any proof. I didn't hear their car. Did you?
translation.ko: 아무 증거도 없잖아 차 소리는 들었어?

translation.en: No, but it's windy. Maybe we just didn't hear it.
translation.ko: 바람 소리 때문에 못 들었을 수도 있지

translation.en: Or maybe they snuck up the road.
Or, maybe we should calm down a little?
I'm sorry. I just-- This really doesn't seem like their house.
translation.ko: 미안한데 난 저들이 이 집 주인 같질 않아

translation.en: The board of the Philharmonic?
I don't know. It just all feels like a con to me.
They want to stay here? With us?
Forget it. I wouldn't be able to sleep with strangers in the house.
translation.ko: 안 돼, 난 낯선 사람들과 한 집에서 못 자

translation.en: Rose is right down the hall. What if he sneaks in…
translation.ko: 로즈가 저 방에 있어 만약 그 남자가…

translation.en: I don't want to think about it.
You don't think he'd want to molest Archie, though.
What are you talking about?
I'm just saying I don't like the way any of this sounds. Okay?
translation.ko: 난 그저 모든 게 찝찝하다는 얘기야

translation.en: He came here because he doesn't want to climb a flight of fucking stairs?
translation.ko: 계단을 못 올라가서 이 먼 데까지 왔다고?

translation.en: Give me a break. All feels a little improvised.
translation.ko: 말도 안 돼 다 꾸며댄 얘기 같아

translation.en: God, what if it's a scam?
[stammering] What if the blackout and whatever that's just all part of the story?
I don't think they made that up.
I mean, that's probably why the phones and the internet aren't working.
And besides, hey. He had the keys.
translation.ko: 참, 그 남자가 열쇠도 갖고 있더라

translation.en: He opened up the liquor cabinet. Remember?
So what if he had the keys?
Maybe he's the handyman. She's the housekeeper.
translation.ko: 남잔 수리공이고 여자앤 가정부일 수도 있지

translation.en: The housekeeper always knows where the stash of money is.
And besides, he had his back to us. Maybe he broke into it.
translation.ko: 남자가 캐비넷을 열쇠 없이 땄을 수도 있고

translation.en: I don't see what he has to gain by giving us a thousand bucks.
Why are you trying so hard to believe everyone except your own wife?
translation.ko: 왜 당신은 내 말을 안 믿고 남들 말만 믿어?

translation.en: Something is happening and I don't trust them.
translation.ko: 저 둘 수상하다고 난 못 믿겠어

translation.en: I think they are scared, nice people who need a place to spend the night.
translation.ko: 그저 잘 곳이 없어 당황한 선량한 사람들일 거야

translation.en: All right, I'm going to go down there and I'm going to talk to them,
and if I get a bad vibe, I-I'm going to say, "No.
We're not comfortable with this arrangement."
Okay? But if things are cool, I say we let them stay.
I wish I had your faith in people.
translation.ko: 나도 사람들을 믿을 수 있으면 좋겠다

translation.en: My own signature cocktail. Happy to make you one.
translation.ko: 제 특제 칵테일인데 한 잔 드릴까요?

translation.en: Yeah, you know, I might have a drink.
Haven't touched this one yet, it's all yours.
Oh, thank you.
How about you, Amanda?
What's in it, exactly?
That is a heck of a cocktail.
You should try this, babe. I think you'd dig it.
I'll pass.
I think I need some fresh air.
You have a beautiful home.
We love it. Glad to hear you do, too.
-[liquid pours] -How long have you been here?
Oh… Bought it almost… …twenty years ago now.
But, at this point, it's… it's home.
Or a home away from home.
We fixed it up about five years back. We had a great contractor.
-A lot of little details were his idea. -Hmm.
Whereabouts is your place in the city?
We are on Park between 81st and 82nd.
What about you?
Uh, Brooklyn. Sunset Park.
Well, it's actually Park Slope.
-Ah, very nice. -Mm-hmm.
That's where everyone wants to live these days. Affordable, too.
I think even Ruth looked over there when she was thinking about flying the coop.
translation.ko: 루스도 한때 독립하려고 그쪽을 알아봤나 봐요

translation.en: Where's your wife? I'm curious if you're worried about her in the city.
translation.ko: 부인은 어디 계세요? 시내에 계시면 걱정 되실 텐데

translation.en: She's on a work trip in Morocco.
She's an art dealer so she travels a lot.
Her flight is due back here in the morning, actually.
Could I see your ID?
Oh, Amanda.
It's a fair ask.
You're a stranger showing up in the middle of the night
and my kids are upstairs.
Of course. I understand.
Mm, well. [chuckles]
You're not going to believe this but I…
left my wallet in my coat pocket, which I checked at the symphony.
translation.ko: 공연장에 맡긴 코트 안 지갑에 있네요

translation.en: In all the commotion, I must have forgotten it there.
You said you heard about the blackout while you were on your way home.
translation.ko: 집에 가는 길에 정전 소식을 들었다면서요?

translation.en: [automated voice] This is a national emergency.
All radio stations and televisions will cease their programs during this alert.
translation.ko: 상황 종료 시까지 모든 방송 프로그램은 중단됩니다

translation.en: Well. Looks like you did the right thing getting out of the city.
-I'm sure it's a mess. -[automated voice stuttering]
Well, we're only talking about a blackout here.
-A blackout is not nothing. -[channels switching, alert continuing]
It could be something. The symptom of something bigger, like terrorism
translation.ko: 테러가 발생했거나 폭탄이 터졌을 수도 있어요

translation.en: or a bomb like the one that you said your son would sleep through.
Ruth.
I think that you should stay here tonight.
Tomorrow, we'll sort through everything.
Things always look different by the light of day.
translation.ko: 햇빛 아래선 모든 게 달리 보이죠

translation.en: I guess self-help clichés are rooted in some truth, huh?
[Ruth] I can't believe we're staying in the basement.
What do we get to do tomorrow? Their laundry?
translation.ko: 내일은 저 사람들 빨래라도 해줘야 돼요?

translation.en: I'll take the floor. You take the bed.
translation.ko: 난 바닥에서 잘게 넌 침대 써

translation.en: We need to get them out of here.
We're not going to do that by scaring them.
They need to think everything's going to be okay.
Everything is going to be okay, isn't it?
What's going on? What are you thinking?
Your client didn't tell you anything else, did he?
There's no point in talking about this until we know more.
That's what I think.
This is a national emergency.
All radio stations and televisions will cease their programs during this alert.
translation.ko: 상황 종료 시까지 모든 방송 프로그램은 중단됩니다

translation.en: This is a national emergency.
All radio stations and televisions will cease their programs during this alert.
translation.ko: 상황 종료 시까지 모든 방송 프로그램은 중단됩니다

translation.en: She was fucking with us.
That girl. She was poking.
Don't take it so personal.
I don't think I can listen to much more of that snark.
translation.ko: 그 가시 돋친 말투 더는 듣기 싫어

translation.en: Even if this does turn out to be their house.
Are we still on that?
Well, there is not one photo on the wall.
Not a wedding picture of the supposed art dealer wife on the business trip
or that spoiled brat as a baby. Think about it.
translation.ko: 그 계집애 아기 때 사진도 없어

translation.en: I'm sure they take them down when they rent the house for privacy concerns.
translation.ko: 집을 렌트할 땐 떼겠지 사생활 보호를 위해서

translation.en: There's just something off about them.
Why didn't you say anything about what we saw at the beach today? That boat.
translation.ko: 낮에 해변에서 본 배 얘긴 왜 안 했어?

translation.en: It was an oil tanker.
Well, why didn't you? Tell them, I mean.
I don't know. Just seemed like it was piling on.
translation.ko: 왠지 그 말까지 하면 뭔가 더 복잡해질 거 같아서

translation.en: Why didn't you?
I was afraid.
Afraid of what?
That it would confirm something.
All radio stations and televisions will cease their programs during this alert.
translation.ko: 상황 종료 시까지 모든 방송 프로그램은 중단됩니다

translation.en: This is a national emergency.
All radio stations and televisions will cease their programs during this alert.
translation.ko: 상황 종료 시까지 모든 방송 프로그램은 중단됩니다

translation.en: [Rose] Mom.
Mom.
Mom.
Rosie. Rose.
Mom, two problems. One: I was literally about to start the Friends series finale,
translation.ko: 두 가지 문제가 있어요 첫째, '프렌즈'를 봐야하는데

translation.en: but the internet on my iPad still isn't working.
I tried to watch it on the TV because I read somewhere that they--
translation.ko: 그래서 TV로 보려고 했거든요? 왜 그거 있잖아요

translation.en: What's it called when they used to play old things over and over again?
Reruns.
Why do they do that again?
I don't know, Rosie. We were really bored back then.
Anyway, th-there's something wrong with the TV. It's all messed up.
translation.ko: 어쨌든 TV도 안 나와요 고장 났다고요

translation.en: That's problem number two. Please fix this.
translation.ko: 그게 두 번째 문제예요 좀 도와줘요

translation.en: I have incredible anxiety about how they're going to wrap up the show.
Don't you think you're taking this a little too seriously?
This isn't fair. It's a vacation.
Dad said on vacation we can have as much screen time as we want.
translation.ko: 아빠가 휴가 땐 영상 실컷 봐도 된댔다고요

translation.en: Well. A: I did not say that.
translation.ko: 대답 A 난 그런 말 안 했어

translation.en: And B: Daddy is still sleeping.
Just go wait in the living room. I'm coming.
Clay.
-[Clay grunts sleepily] -Get up. Look. Look.
-It doesn't say anything. -What?
-It was just there. -Mm, you sure? What did it say?
Yes, of course I'm sure.
There were four news alerts. Um…
Uh, two about the blackout and one that said, um… hackers were behind the power outage.
translation.ko: 두 개는 정전 소식 하나는 해커들이 배후라는 소식

translation.en: -Hackers? -Yeah.
And then there was one that said, uh, "breaking" but then it was just gibberish.
No words, just random letters.
Maybe they hacked the cell network?
Is that-Is that a question? Are you fucking asking me? How would I know?
translation.ko: 지금 나한테 묻는 거야? 내가 그걸 어떻게 알아?

translation.en: Why are you being so nonplussed about all of this?
Did you forget those people are still in our house?
translation.ko: 그 두 사람 아직 여깄는 거 잊었어?

translation.en: -I trusted you to handle this. -[sighs]
I'm gonna drive into town.
I'll go to the store, buy a newspaper,
find someone who knows more than we do.
All right? I will take care of this for us.
Whose car is that?
Looks expensive.
Let's get some breakfast.
Uh, so listen, honey. About that car.
Last night, these people…
…the Scotts. They had to come by.
There's been…
…um, they had a problem and they weren't far from here. So they, they came here.
translation.ko: 사정상 집에 못 가게 돼서 가까운 여기로 왔대

translation.en: What are you even talking about?
I'll take some of that coffee.
Oh. I was just telling Rose about the Scotts.
-Dad, the TV isn't working. -Whoa, whoa, whoa. Easy, baby.
-Come on. -Dad, can you fix it?
Yeah.
Well, now it's snow. Last night it was a blue screen.
translation.ko: 이젠 눈이 오네 어젯밤엔 파란 화면이더니

translation.en: -I wonder what that means. -What?
Yeah, see?
No. It's just- it's not working.
I'm aware. Can you like, reboot it or something?
translation.ko: 그건 아는데 재부팅 같은 거 안 돼요?

translation.en: -Or go up on the roof or whatever? -No one's going on the roof.
translation.ko: - 지붕에 올라가 보든가요 - 지붕엔 올라가면 안 돼

translation.en: I am definitely not going up on the roof.
Okay? But I'm going to go to the store later
and maybe I can find something that will, you know, help.
You know, get one of those, uh, some rabbit ears or something.
translation.ko: 왜, 토끼 귀 같은 거 있잖아

translation.en: Why would a rabbit's ear help?
Good morning.
You mind if I have some coffee?
Help yourself. You know where the mugs are, right?
I had news alerts on my phone this morning.
translation.ko: 오늘 아침 내 폰에 긴급 뉴스가 떴어

translation.en: -Your phone is working? -No.
They must have come in overnight somehow, and then they disappeared.
translation.ko: 밤에 뜬 뉴스 같은데 곧 사라졌어

translation.en: What did they say?
There were two about the blackout and then something about hackers being behind it.
translation.ko: 두 개는 정전 소식 하나는 해커가 배후라는 얘기

translation.en: -Hackers? -Mm-hmm.
Where are the power plants in New York City?
I mean, they must be in Queens, I guess. Or-Or near the river?
Why are you asking about power plants?
Hackers can get into power plants. That's probably how they caused the outage.
translation.ko: 해커가 발전소를 해킹해서 정전을 일으켰을 거예요

translation.en: You remember that thing that happened in Jersey a few years back? It nearly caused a meltdown.
translation.ko: 몇 년 전 뉴저지 사태 땐 방사능 유출까지 우려됐었죠

translation.en: Is that your daughter out there?
She's sweet. How old is she?
Thirteen, last month.
Still kind of a baby at heart.
If it's okay with you, I would like to keep what's going on between the adults.
translation.ko: 이 모든 건 애들에게 비밀로 해줬으면 좋겠어

translation.en: The kids like the pool.
I'm just going to encourage them to do that until we know more.
I don't want them to panic over nothing.
I don't want to scare anyone but I disagree with you.
translation.ko: 그건 좋은데 한 가진 동의 못 하겠네요

translation.en: Disagree with me about what?
I don't think this is nothing.
So, what is it that you do?
I'm in advertising, on the client side. I manage relationships.
translation.ko: 광고 회사에서 클라이언트 관련 업무를 해

translation.en: Huh. I would not have guessed that.
And what about your husband?
Uh, Clay is a professor at City College.
English and media studies.
You know, I've had plenty of friends major in media studies
but I never know what it means.
And you, what is it that you do?
Me, I'm… [chuckles] I'm still figuring my shit out, trying not to rush into anything.
translation.ko: 뭘 할지 아직 고민 중이에요 천천히 생각해 보려고요

translation.en: The last thing that I want is to be sucked into a career
that I regret ten years from now
by which point I will be trapped by the pressure to stay the course
because I'll be too old to re-enter the workforce. You know what I mean.
Morning. Any news?
translation.ko: 좋은 아침 무슨 소식 좀 있어요?

translation.en: Phone's still not working.
Looks like the TV's out. Where's Clay?
translation.ko: TV도 고장인 거 같고… 클레이는 어딨죠?

translation.en: He went to the store to get a newspaper.
Or try to find someone to talk to, to see if they know what's going on.
translation.ko: 상황이 어떻게 돌아가는지 소식도 들어볼 겸

translation.en: Smart. I thought I'd go over to our neighbors house, the Huxleys.
translation.ko: 현명하시네, 전 이웃인 헉슬리네 가볼까 했는데

translation.en: -They only live a few miles down the road. -And you think they'll be home?
Unlikely.
You often see no one here around this time,
but I'll drive over anyway and check.
Before you go, you might want to hear about the alerts.
Alerts?
Oh, I had news alerts on my phone this morning.
Two of them were about the blackout
but then there was one that said something about maybe hackers were behind it.
What? Do you think there's going to be a meltdown, too?
-Is that what Ruth told you? -Among other horrifying things, yes.
translation.ko: - 루스가 그래요? - 네, 겁을 팍팍 주더군요

translation.en: Well, obviously Ruth is being a little paranoid.
translation.ko: 얘가 지금 좀 신경과민 상태인가 봐요

translation.en: Aren't you the one who always said,
"If you're not paranoid by now, it's probably too late"?
translation.ko: '지금 신경과민이 돼야 나중에 후회 안 한다'

translation.en: I'm sure this'll turn out to be a big nothing.
Like that Love You bug.
Is that coffee?
I-I'm sorry. What's a Love You bug?
Um, it was a computer worm. Spread throughout the internet back in 2000.
People would get an email with the subject line that read "I love you."
You clicked on the attachment, it would send it to all your contacts.
translation.ko: 첨부 파일을 클릭하면 순식간에 확산되는 거죠

translation.en: It crippled businesses and caused billions of dollars in damages.
Turns out, it was just two teenagers in the Philippines.
Could be just as innocent as that.
I think I'll go rush Archie along.
I'm worried about Mom.
You think her flight is going to be okay?
Sure.
Matter of fact, I bet she's…
…been redirected to some airport in Ohio.
She's probably cursing out every customer service rep
till they put her on a plane home.
translation.ko: 집에 오는 비행기를 꼭 탈 거야

translation.en: Do you remember that time the three of us went to Italy?
Yeah, I do.
What made you think of that?
I don't know what else to think about.
Who'd Mom say these people were again?
What're you looking at?
[garbled voice] …we're now getting reports that the fallout from the ongoing Cyber attack
has led to a catastrophic environmental disaster in the South,
impacting animal migration patterns--
Archie, I saw something this morning.
Deer.
They're everywhere, dumbass.
They're like squirrels or pigeons. Who cares?
No, this was different. Like…
…they were trying to tell us something.
Let's see what else is out there.
Are you really that bored? Is this because you can't watch your show?
translation.ko: 그렇게 심심하냐? 드라마를 못 봐서 그래?

translation.en: I'm going.
Hello, anyone home? It's G.H. I let myself in.
Hello?
What's in that thing?
Let's open it and see.
-Yeah? Hey, hi. -Hello!
Okay, I-I don't understand what you're saying. I don't, I don't speak, um… I don't speak Spanish.
This place is so fucking boring.
Yeah.
Maybe it's just where he sleeps, though.
Where he hides at night.
Who?
Whoever made that impression.
I-I don't, I don't know where I am. I'm trying to get to town.
translation.ko: 저도 길을 몰라요 시내로 가려고 하는데…

translation.en: No, no, I-I don't have any service either.
Look, he's, uh…
He's got this little window over here.
So he can see…
See what?
Sorry.
Hey.
Isn't that the room you were sleeping in?
Shit…
Just imagine.
It's all dark out here.
Oh, my God.
Your little bedside lamp is glowing.
translation.ko: 근데 네 침대 스탠드는 켜져 있어

translation.en: Oh, shit.
Oh, shit!
He could just follow that light right up to you.
translation.ko: 그럼 여기서 네가 얼마나 잘 보이겠냐

translation.en: Oh, shit. [panicked yell]
That's not funny, Archie. That really hurt.
[laughing] You'll be fine.
No, I won't.
Dude, calm the fuck down. It was just a joke.
This morning I saw deer.
Not a deer, a fuck lot of deer. A hundred. Maybe more. Right in the backyard.
translation.ko: 한 마리가 아니라 엄청 많았어 100마리쯤 뒷마당에 있었다고

translation.en: It was really weird, Archie.
Do they go around in big groups like that?
Why the fuck would I know anything about deer?
If you're so worried about it, why don't you just ask Mom and Dad?
[scoffs] Like they would even care.
No one cares what I say.
That's probably true.
You going in?
No. You?
Seems like a hassle.
Why? Because of your hair, or…?
More like I don't trust that one of your kids didn't pee in the pool.
translation.ko: 아줌마네 애들이 저 안에 오줌 쌌을까 봐요

translation.en: They wouldn't do that.
And yet, we really can't know, can we?
Your daughter watches that show?
"Watch" is far too weak of a word. More like worships.
translation.ko: 그냥 보는 정도가 아니라 열혈 팬이지

translation.en: What?
Don't get me wrong, I watched it too.
But it's almost… nostalgic for a time that never existed, you know?
translation.ko: 존재하지도 않는 시대에 대한 추억팔이 같더라고요

translation.en: I hope the kids didn't wander off too far.
Archie.
Archie, look.
Will you please look?
[Archie] What?
We should go up there.
No. No, fuck that. I'm hungry. Come on, let's go.
Rose, let's go.
So…
You going to tell us why you're soaking wet?
I fell into the pool.
You fell into the… pool.
I tripped over something.
Yeah, I fell into the pool.
What were you doing near the pool? I thought you were looking for Rich.
translation.ko: 리치를 만난다더니 수영장 옆엔 왜 갔어요?

translation.en: Do you mind going to my study and getting me something to wear?
translation.ko: 내 서재에 가서 입을 옷 좀 갖다줄래?

translation.en: I'm afraid this is the only change of clothes I had downstairs.
I saw it, you know?
A while ago, before all this happened.
I looked at the market.
And I knew something was coming.
What do you mean?
In my line of work, you have to understand the patterns that govern the world.
translation.ko: 내 직업은 세상을 지배하는 패턴을 읽는 거예요

translation.en: You have to learn how to read the curve.
Spend as long as I have doing it, it can help you see the future.
translation.ko: 그걸 오래 하다 보면 미래가 보여요

translation.en: It holds steady, it promises harmony.
translation.ko: 선이 완만하면 모든 게 조화로운 거고

translation.en: It inches up or down, you know that means something.
G.H., why-why are you telling me this?
translation.ko: G.H., 왜 나한테 그 얘길 하는 거죠?

translation.en: Did your neighbor say something to you?
No, he wasn't home.
But he has a satellite phone I thought could help us.
I tried to use it. It didn't work even though it had enough juice.
Now, the whole point of a satellite phone is that you always have a signal
if you have a clear view of the sky, which I did.
Only reason why it wouldn't work
is if our satellites got knocked out of commission.
Our satellites.
You think something happened to our satellites. The ones in space.
translation.ko: 문제가 생겼다는 거예요? 우주에 있는 위성에?

translation.en: Satellites are networked to computers down here.
So you think that the hackers or whatever knocked out our satellites?
translation.ko: 그러니까 해커인지 뭔지가 우리 위성을 고장 냈다?

translation.en: Don't you think you're maybe getting a little carried away?
I mean, maybe you just didn't use the phone right.
I saw a plane nosedive out of the sky into the ocean.
And it wasn't the first.
I no longer think that this is just a couple of teenagers in the Philippines.
What the fuck?
What the fuck?
Where are my kids?
[Rose] Mommy.
Where's Dad?
He'll be back soon.
Why are you wet?
I should have covered my ears sooner.
Now my head feels weird.
That's probably normal. It was really loud.
translation.ko: 그게 정상일 거야 소리가 워낙 컸잖아

translation.en: Was it like a, um, like a-a plane breaking the sound barrier?
translation.ko: 비행기가 초음속 비행을 할 때 나는 소리였을까요?

translation.en: Or whatever that-- a sonic boom. Was, was that a sonic boom?
Planes don't usually break the sound barrier.
The Concorde doesn't fly anymore.
Maybe it was a plane that we don't know about.
Archie, why don't you go get changed.
[Ruth] Rose, maybe you should too.
That's a good idea.
Why don't you go cuddle up in Mommy's bed and read that book Dad got you.
translation.ko: 엄마 침대에 누워서 아빠가 사준 책 읽어

translation.en: We're, um, we're going to be okay, right?
Yeah.
Since you're the one with the crystal ball, what was that?
Was that a bomb? A missile?
Could have been a power plant explosion.
We don't know anything for certain yet.
You seemed pretty certain a minute ago with your fucking haunting soliloquy.
translation.ko: 아까 혼자 떠드실 땐 확신에 차있더니!

translation.en: Nothing's changed.
Nothing's changed?
Everything has changed.
And we're sitting here like… like I don't know what.
Is-Is this what sitting ducks are? Ducks sitting and waiting to be shot?
translation.ko: 사냥감처럼 총 맞아 죽길 기다려야 돼요?

translation.en: I meant nothing has changed in terms of what we do.
translation.ko: 우리가 할 일이 안 달라졌다는 거예요

translation.en: We wait for Clay to come back and we see what he's learned.
Should I drive to town and look for him?
We should fill the bathtubs full of water.
Is there enough batteries, and Tylenol, and food, and the generator,
and one of those hand crank radios,
and a straw that makes it safe to drink dirty water.
I think we shouldn't do anything until Clay comes back.
translation.ko: 클레이가 올 때까지 아무것도 해선 안 돼요

translation.en: What if he's not coming back?
Okay, my dad is right.
We're safe here. We should just sit tight.
How do you know that we're safe
when you don't know what the fuck is happening to us?
Maybe it was like, what was that? Ten Mile Island?
There are power plants here, aren't there?
-Three Mile Island. -Why are you obsessed with power plants?
translation.ko: - '쓰리 마일 섬' - 왜 계속 발전소 타령이야?

translation.en: Hey, you're right. We shouldn't speculate.
Stop saying that!
I just want you to fucking tell me what you're thinking.
There's the blackout and then you see the planes crashing and…
translation.ko: 정전에 이어 비행기 추락 사고도 봤고 또…

translation.en: What?
What? She's an adult.
You cannot protect her, just like you cannot protect me right now.
translation.ko: 나처럼 얘도 지금은 당신이 못 지켜줘요

translation.en: The satellite phone not working and then that noise, and then what?
translation.ko: 위성폰도 안 되고 비행기 굉음에 다음은 뭐죠?

translation.en: What happens next in that sequence?
Everything I know I have told you.
I don't believe you.
I haven't believed you since you walked through that front door.
translation.ko: 저 문으로 들어올 때부터 안 믿었어요

translation.en: Golly. I wonder what it is about us that makes you so mistrustful.
translation.ko: 헐! 우릴 왜 그렇게 못 믿는지 궁금하네요

translation.en: Ruth…
You always think you know what you're talking about, don't you?
translation.ko: 넌 늘 네가 엄청 똑똑한 거 같지?

translation.en: Well, ain't that the pot calling the kettle black?
translation.ko: 똥 묻은 개가 겨 묻은 개 나무라시네

translation.en: Ruth.
He knew.
At the market in town yesterday, there was a guy in the parking lot.
translation.ko: 어제 시내 마트 주차장에서 어떤 남자를 봤는데

translation.en: He bought cases of water and canned goods.
He knew this was going to happen.
Bearded guy?
Probably wearing an old Cowboys hat.
That's Danny. He's the contractor I was telling you about.
The one who worked on the house.
I wouldn't read into it. He's a self-proclaimed survivalist.
That shopping list was probably a typical weekend for him.
translation.ko: 주말마다 늘 그런 걸 살 거예요

translation.en: Jesus Christ.
I'm here. I'm okay, are you okay? Where are the kids?
translation.ko: 나 왔어, 당신 괜찮아? 애들은 어딨어?

translation.en: -Everyone's here, everyone's okay. -Okay.
What happened? Did you get to town?
I didn't get far. And then I heard that noise.
translation.ko: 멀리 못 갔어 가다가 그 소릴 들었어

translation.en: What do you mean? Where have you been? What were you doing? I was going crazy.
translation.ko: 뭐? 여태 어디 있었는데? 걱정돼서 죽을 뻔했어

translation.en: I don't know, I-I just started to drive,
and then I heard that noise, and I came right back.
So you didn't see anyone that might help us figure out what's happening here.
translation.ko: 이 상황을 설명해줄 사람을 못 만났겠군요

translation.en: No, I did not see anyone.
But I did see something. I saw--
It was this huge, um, drone.
You know, flying in the middle of nowhere, dropping off thousands of these.
translation.ko: 그게 갑자기 나타나 이걸 수천 장 뿌렸는데

translation.en: I have no idea what it says.
"Death to America."
What?
"Death to America."
I mean, I don't know what the rest of this means,
but this part, it definitely means "Death to America."
I remember from a game I was playing.
Nothing about this makes sense.
If they were attacking us, why would they advertise it like this?
It's not even in English. What's the point of dropping these things here?
translation.ko: 게다가 영어도 아닌 전단을 누가 본다고!

translation.en: I'm pretty sure I make that first right, then it's a straight shot to the expressway?
translation.ko: 첫 우회전 후 쭉 가서 고속도로를 타면 되죠?

translation.en: With what we know, the city would be the worst place for you to go.
translation.ko: 지금 뉴욕에 가는 건 최악의 선택이에요

translation.en: We're not going to the city. We're going to my sister's in Jersey.
translation.ko: 뉴욕이 아니고 뉴저지의 우리 언니네로 가요

translation.en: But to get to New Jersey from here, you have to drive through the city.
But to be clear, I make a right, follow signs to the Expressway.
translation.ko: 어쨌든 우회전 후 표지만 따라가면 되죠?

translation.en: Yes, exactly like how you got here. But listen to me, please.
translation.ko: 네, 온 길 반대로 가면 되죠 근데 제발

translation.en: This is dangerous what you're doing, for you and your family.
translation.ko: 가지 마요 당신 가족 모두 위험해져요

translation.en: Dad.
Let them go.
I really appreciate you taking care of us, I do.
We have to do what's right for our family.
This is in everyone's best interest.
This is for the better.
For who?
For us.
I don't want to have to agree with that woman, but she was right.
translation.ko: 동의하긴 싫지만 그 여자 말이 맞아요

translation.en: And you really should've told me what you saw.
translation.ko: 아빤 본 걸 왜 나한테 숨겼어요?

translation.en: Hey, I know what you're thinking,
but I'm certain your mother's plane wouldn't be flying over here.
translation.ko: 엄마 비행기는 이쪽으로 안 왔을 거야

translation.en: It wasn't the same airline.
Is she gone?
Oh, come on now. Why are you even going there?
I just told you, it wasn't even the same airline.
Yeah, but does it feel like she's gone?
translation.ko: 근데 왜 난 엄마가 죽은 것 같죠?

translation.en: [voice shaking] Because it does to me.
If we hit traffic, at least we'll be able to talk to people,
translation.ko: 혹시 차가 보이면 이 상황에 대해서

translation.en: see if anyone has information about what's going on.
It's crazy we haven't seen anyone.
I'm sure we will see someone as soon as we hit the Expressway.
[Amanda] Phones could work in New Jersey.
The truth is we don't know anything that's going on outside of Long Island.
translation.ko: 롱아일랜드 밖의 상황을 우린 전혀 모르잖아

translation.en: They could have internet, the phone lines could be okay.
We'll look back on this one day and laugh, I guarantee you.
The vacation from Hell. [chuckles]
Things get funnier with time. Isn't that what they say?
I think they say it a little differently.
But, you know, I know what you mean.
Sirens.
I thought you were napping, honey.
[Rose] I can't.
Why not?
Because of the sirens.
What is that?
You stay with the kids. I'm gonna go take a look.
You know what, you guys, sit-- Sit tight, okay?
translation.ko: 너흰 차 안에 꼼짝 말고 있어

translation.en: See anyone?
There's nobody here.
They're all brand new.
What?
Oh, wow. Hey, someone's coming.
Yo!
Clay!
-Clay, get in the car! -Wait, shouldn't we wait and talk to them?
-Get in the fucking car right now! -All right, all right.
What are you doing? Shouldn't we flag them down?
translation.ko: 왜 그래? 저들이 뭔가 알지도 모르잖아

translation.en: -Maybe they know something. -There's no one in that car!
translation.ko: 왜 그래? 저들이 뭔가 알지도 모르잖아 그 차에 아무도 없어!

translation.en: Mom? Mom, on your left, there's a car! Go, go, go, go!
What if we went to a shelter?
Does the military have a bomb shelter or a base around here?
I mean, don't they have to have those things ready for…
…emergencies like these?
I don't know where they are.
Even if I did, you said all those cars came off the lot.
translation.ko: 게다가 그 차들 갓 출고된 차라면서요?

translation.en: If they did that to every dealership, the main roads are most likely clogged up.
translation.ko: 모든 대리점 차가 다 나왔다면 주 도로는 대부분 막혔겠죠

translation.en: We stay here till we know more.
How much more do we need to know? We're probably in the middle of a war zone.
translation.ko: 우린 지금 전쟁터의 중심에 있는 건지도 몰라요

translation.en: People we know are likely dead.
translation.ko: 우리 주변 사람은 다 죽었을 거고요

translation.en: Ruth.
Just--
We just need to make a plan.
We can't sit here and do nothing. We need to go somewhere.
translation.ko: 여기 있지 말고 딴 데로 가야 돼

translation.en: He's right, Amanda. It's too dangerous.
We stay here tonight, and then in the morning, maybe--
-Maybe what? -Maybe-- I don't know.
I was so close.
What are you doing?
Filling up the tub.
That's what they say to do for,
you know, water.
Do you vape?
Not really.
I mean, is that-- That's like, marijuana?
I mean, I know they got different kinds now, like fruit flavors or--
Like marijuana.
Have you ever fucked one of your students?
I can't believe you just asked me that.
I mean, is that what I look like to you? I look like that kind of guy?
You look like the kind of guy to whom things come easy.
translation.ko: 왠지 뭐든 쉽게 가질 수 있는 분 같아서요

translation.en: Especially women.
Well, I'll take that as a compliment, I guess. Hmm?
I always thought of myself as a sophisticated man.
Someone who had seen the world for what it was.
But I have never seen anything like this.
So now, I wonder if that thing I always thought about myself was a delusion.
translation.ko: 내가 생각해온 내 모습은 환상이었나 봐요

translation.en: I wouldn't be too hard on yourself.
You dig deep enough, it's probably all a delusion.
translation.ko: 어쩌면 모든 게 환상일 수도 있죠

translation.en: I mean, take your line of work, for example.
Imaginary numbers,
moving around imaginary money, leading to imaginary success.
Personally, I think my business is a lot less complicated than all that.
translation.ko: 난 내 일이 그렇게 복잡하다곤 생각 안 해요

translation.en: At its most basic, my work is and always has been about people.
translation.ko: 내 업무는 기본적으로 사람에 관한 거에요

translation.en: -I'm real sorry for you then. -And why is that?
Because people are terrible.
I mean, fuck. Look at the way I treated you.
And now we are enjoying a drink together.
I am sorry, by the way.
For what I said, did, thought, it doesn't matter.
translation.ko: 내가 한 말과 행동 다 잊어버리세요

translation.en: I was wrong and I'm sorry.
Some of my smartest clients have lost a lot of money
translation.ko: 내 똑똑한 클라이언트 중엔 거액을 잃은 사람들이 있어요

translation.en: because they based their choices on preconceived beliefs instead of truth.
translation.ko: 그들은 팩트가 아닌 편견을 토대로 투자를 했거든요

translation.en: Seeing the difference is one of the hardest things a person can do.
When they don't and you do, gotta be maddening.
Depending on the person,
I might take a little satisfaction in watching the market punish them.
translation.ko: 그런 실수로 손해를 보면 쌤통이다 싶기도 해요

translation.en: The scary ones, though, are the ones who don't learn.
Even after they lose lots, and I mean lots, of money.
Nothing frightens me more than a person unwilling to learn,
even at their own expense.
That's a darkness I will never understand.
translation.ko: 내가 절대 이해 못 할 부류니까

translation.en: The quiet is so noisy.
It's one of the first things I noticed when we started spending nights here.
translation.ko: 여기 처음 살 때부터 그걸 느꼈어요

translation.en: Found it hard to sleep.
Not like at home, where you hear everything.
Sirens, traffic, people.
I miss that.
Which, the sirens or the people?
I am starting to like you,
and that is a bold statement coming from me because…
translation.ko: 나 원래 이런 말 잘 안 해요

translation.en: I can't remember the last time I liked anybody.
I have to say, I found you very prickly at the outset,
but you've grown on me.
Why did you really come here?
And don't tell me it's because of your knee.
That wasn't a lie. I did have a knee surgery.
Twisted it up pretty bad playing ball down at the Y.
But it's not why you came here.
Why I came here involves something that happened to me a few years back.
translation.ko: 몇 년 전에 있었던 일도 여기 온 이유 중의 하나죠

translation.en: One of my clients invited me and my wife to a private event.
translation.ko: 한 클라이언트가 아내와 날 사적인 자리에 초대했어요

translation.en: My client, he…
Well.
I won't say his name, but you'd recognize it though.
translation.ko: 이름을 말 안 해도 알 만한 사람이에요

translation.en: -Is he a celebrity? -Oh, no. Nothing like that.
But in the business world, he's one of the biggest out there.
He deals mostly in defense contracting.
I'm talking hush-hush, top-secret money from the Pentagon.
translation.ko: 국방성의 기밀 자금이 오가는 극비 사업이죠

translation.en: Perhaps the most powerful person I've ever had a meal with.
Anyway, we're at this soiree at his house.
translation.ko: 어쨌든 그의 집에서 저녁 파티를 즐기던 중

translation.en: It's getting late. My wife, she wants to go.
translation.ko: 내 아내가 밤이 늦었다며 집에 가자는 거예요

translation.en: But he and I are just having a blast, and he doesn't want the night to end.
translation.ko: 하지만 그와 난 파티를 더 즐기고 싶었죠

translation.en: After a few more glares,
my wife agrees to take a cab and I'll come home after.
Mm, I bet she was real happy about that.
So, we're having a few more drinks, getting really sauced, and at one point,
translation.ko: 우린 술을 몇 잔 더 마셨고 결국 만취해서

translation.en: I don't think he could stand and I was pretty wobbly, myself.
I wouldn't know anything about that, sir.
So he takes me to his study.
Smoke a few cigars
and we're sort of flying high, laughing at almost everything.
Eventually he starts in on how much he likes me,
and how he wishes he could invite me on this trip he's about to go on.
translation.ko: 자기 여행 갈 때 함께 못 가 아쉽다고 하더군요

translation.en: What kind of trip? Where is he going?
That's exactly what I asked.
Then he…
turns to me,
serious face.
And he says…
"Oh, you know, "just my annual meeting
with the rest of the evil cabal that runs the world."
He was the kind of guy that was always known for jokes like that.
Again, if I told you his name, you would understand.
translation.ko: 이름을 들으면 아마 이해가 될 거예요

translation.en: Well, I just have to take your word for it.
And now if you'll excuse me, I'm gonna top off my wine.
translation.ko: 괜찮으면 난 와인 한 잔 더 마실게요

translation.en: Then yesterday, before the symphony,
my friend calls me up.
No scheduled appointment, like he usually does.
Just calls me out of the blue
and wants me to move around some of his money.
And we're talking some big numbers, even for him.
And as we're getting off the phone, I asked if he wanted to grab a drink.
translation.ko: 전화를 끊기 전에 술 한잔 하쟀더니

translation.en: He tells me he's going away for a while.
And I joke back to him,
"Oh, yeah? You hanging with your evil cabal this weekend?
I thought that was only during the winter solstice."
But he doesn't laugh.
And he always laughs, even with bad jokes.
All he said was…
"Take care of yourself."
Almost as if he felt sorry for me.
Ever since, I haven't been able to get it out of my head.
translation.ko: 그 뒤로 그 말이 계속 생각났어요

translation.en: Are you saying that--
Are you thinking that your friend is somehow behind what's happening here?
translation.ko: 이 일과 어떤 연관이 있다고 생각하는 거예요?

translation.en: No, nothing like that.
A conspiracy theory about a shadowy group of people running the world
is far too lazy of an explanation.
translation.ko: 설명 안 되는 일이 너무 많죠

translation.en: Especially when the truth is much scarier.
What is the truth?
No one is in control. No one is pulling the strings.
translation.ko: 이 모든 걸 조종하는 사람이 없다는 거요

translation.en: Sure, there are those like my friend
who might have the right kind of access to the right kind of information.
translation.ko: 정보를 더 잘 접할 수 있는 사람은 있겠죠

translation.en: But when events like this happen in the world,
the best, even the most powerful people can hope for
is a heads up.
Sorry, this…
Guess this story's kind of a buzzkill.
Changed my mind. I don't think I like you anymore.
Come on.
Let's go.
Where are we going?
I'm gonna win you over again.
[Archie] I see you, Rose.
What do you want?
I'm never going to find out what happens to Ross and Rachel, am I?
translation.ko: 로스와 레이첼의 결말을 난 결국 못 보겠지?

translation.en: You're still on this shit?
Who gives a fuck?
Well, I do. Obviously.
Why do you care so much about that show anyway?
translation.ko: 대체 왜 그 드라마에 꽂힌 건데?

translation.en: [swallows] They make me happy.
I really need that right now. Don't you?
translation.ko: 지금 그 느낌이 필요해 오빤 안 그래?

translation.en: If there's any hope left in this fucked up world,
I wanna at least find out how things turn out for them.
I care about them.
Maybe you shouldn't.
I'm just saying.
You're probably right, the way things are going
you're not gonna see that show ever again.
translation.ko: 그 드라마 다시 보긴 힘들 거야

translation.en: So if I were you, I'd find something else to care about.
translation.ko: 나라면 다른 일에 관심을 가질 거야

translation.en: [Ruth] It's weird, we're not hearing any cicadas tonight.
translation.ko: 오늘 밤엔 매미 소리도 안 들리네요

translation.en: I got lost today.
When I went out this morning.
What do you mean you got lost?
I thought I knew where I was going
but then there were all these streets that didn't have any signs anywhere.
So I just drove around.
Then I drove around some more.
And then, you know, I turn around, and then I got just completely lost,
translation.ko: 차를 돌렸는데 어디가 어딘질 모르겠는 거야

translation.en: and I have no idea how I found my way back here, to be honest.
translation.ko: 집에 어떻게 왔는지도 기억이 안 나

translation.en: But I did see someone.
A woman.
On the road.
She waved me down and, um,
she was speaking Spanish.
She was just standing there
by the side of the road in the middle of nowhere.
[voice shaking] And I…
I left her.
She needed help.
And I left her.
Well, is there anything else that you're keeping from us?
translation.ko: 우리한테 말 안 한 게 또 있어요?

translation.en: Since you're opening up, that is.
Well, we didn't tell you before that we saw an oil tanker ground.
translation.ko: 아, 그 말을 안 했군 유조선이 상륙한 걸 봤어

translation.en: Like, right up on the beach.
An oil tanker?
Yeah, it's like a really big boat.
You know, it's red. I mean, well, I don't think that they're all red,
translation.ko: 선체가 빨간색이었어 유조선이 다 그렇진 않을 텐데

translation.en: but this one was, and it came right up on the beach.
Why didn't you tell us?
Well, I think at the time we were both scared, you know?
translation.ko: 그 당시엔 우리 둘 다 두려웠나 봐

translation.en: About what it could mean.
Well, what could it mean?
Well, if we were being attacked,
which I know sounds weird to say, but oil is something
that you would want a lot of if, you know, we're going to defend ourselves.
I cannot believe we're having this conversation.
I really think we're gonna be all right.
You know, I mean, in the end, I really do.
I mean, even if it is like, an invasion.
An invasion?
Well, or an occupation?
Okay, dude, you know what? I know that you mean well,
but your word choices are, like, freaking me the fuck out.
What was that?
Those are… flamingos.
Those are flamingos?
Those are flamingos.
Why?
Wow, this is an impressive collection.
You like jazz?
You want to listen to jazz?
Sure, why not?
Because I thought we were going to have some fun.
Let's have something we could dance to.
You can dance to jazz.
In fact, when I bought my first record, that was--
Oh, please not another one of your stories.
They end up leaving me severely disturbed. Wait. What are these records?
Don't look over there. Those are my daughter's records.
translation.ko: 거긴 보지 마요 내 딸 거예요

translation.en: She had a DJ phase in college.
translation.ko: 대학 때 잠시 DJ 일에 심취했었거든요

translation.en: Now this looks like something a lady can properly dance to.
Oh, come on. That's not what I brought you in here for.
translation.ko: 나 참, 그런 거 틀려고 데려온 게 아닌데

translation.en: You said you wanted to win me over.
This is how.
We're drunk.
We are…
Ah, we're married. I'm married. You have a wife.
translation.ko: 그리고 난 남편이 당신은 부인이 있죠

translation.en: I do, yes.
I love her dearly.
I really…
I really miss her.
You'll see her again.
No.
No, I don't think I will.
And Ruth.
What if something happened to her too? I don't think I could live with myself.
translation.ko: 딸까지 무슨 일이 생기면 난 살 수 없을 거예요

translation.en: Nothing is going to happen to Ruth. I promise.
translation.ko: 루스에겐 절대 아무 일도 안 일어나요

translation.en: We're in this together with you till things get back to normal.
translation.ko: 모든 게 정상이 될 때까지 우리가 옆에 있을게요

translation.en: Amanda, we gotta start seeing this for what it is.
There is no going back to normal.
Don't say that. We have to--
Is he okay?
He's a little warm, but I think he'll be fine.
What are you still doing up?
I keep thinking about this one West Wing episode.
There's this story, someone tells the president--
You watched The West Wing?
Only the Aaron Sorkin seasons.
Anyway, the story was about a man who lived by the river.
translation.ko: 어쨌든 줄거리는 이래요 강가에 사는 한 남자가

translation.en: And he hears on the radio that the river is going to flood the town
and everyone should leave.
But the man doesn't go anywhere because he prays every day.
translation.ko: 그는 아무 데도 안 가요 자긴 늘 기도하니까

translation.en: He knows that God loves him and will save him.
But then the flood actually happens.
And this guy in a rowboat sees the man
translation.ko: 곧 어떤 남자가 배를 몰고 와서

translation.en: and says, "Hey, come on, I can save you."
But the man tells him he isn't going anywhere.
Then the helicopter comes flying by, and the pilot lowers the ladder,
translation.ko: 그 뒤 헬리콥터가 와서 사다리를 내려줘도

translation.en: but the man tells him he isn't going anywhere.
After that, the man drowns in the flood.
And so he goes up to heaven and he's really angry at God,
and he tells him, "I prayed to you every day.
I thought you loved me. Why didn't you save me?"
translation.ko: '난 매일 기도했고 당신의 사랑을 믿었어요' '근데 왜 안 구해줬죠?'

translation.en: And God says,
"I sent you a radio report,
a rowboat and a helicopter.
What more do you want?"
What's this about, Rose?
I think I'm done waiting.
-Dad? -Hmm?
Will you sleep in the bed with me?
Not sure.
The bed's not big, and I don't mind sleeping on the floor.
translation.ko: 침대가 좁아서 난 마루에서 자도 돼

translation.en: -It's sometimes good for my back. -I'm scared.
translation.ko: 가끔은 그게 허리에도 좋대 나 무서워요

translation.en: It's just us now, isn't it?
What do you mean by that?
What I mean is,
if the shit goes down, do you trust these people that are in our house?
translation.ko: 무슨 일이 생기면 저 사람들을 믿어도 될까요?

translation.en: We already know the wife has no chill.
That boy was sneaking pictures of me by the pool.
translation.ko: 남자앤 수영장 옆에서 내 몰카를 찍었고

translation.en: That little girl keeps staring into the woods like Donnie Darko,
and I'm pretty sure the husband wants to fuck me.
translation.ko: 걔들 아빤 나랑 자고 싶어 하고요

translation.en: How do you know that?
He's not actually going to do anything, he's not "that guy."
But did he want to? Abso-fucking-lutely.
My point remains, I don't trust them.
translation.ko: 어쨌든 난 저 사람들 안 믿어요

translation.en: I'm not gonna let anything happen to you, if that's what you're asking.
translation.ko: 넌 내가 지켜줄 거야 그걸 묻는 거라면

translation.en: I'm asking for you to remember that if the world falls apart,
trust should not be doled out easily to anyone,
translation.ko: 누구도 쉽게 믿어선 안 된다는 거예요

translation.en: especially white people.
Even mom would agree with me on that.
I got it.
Do you?
Because we're sleeping in the basement of our own house for the second night in a row.
translation.ko: 우린 지금 우리 집 지하실에서 이틀째 자고 있어요

translation.en: Just what exactly was the point of letting them back into the house?
translation.ko: 저 사람들을 왜 다시 집에 들인 거예요?

translation.en: It was the right thing to do.
And that right there. That's what's going to fuck us in the end.
translation.ko: 그게 결국은 우리에겐 독이 될 거예요

translation.en: [Clay] Drink up.
Where's Rosie?
I don't know. She got up before us.
I'm gonna have a look around. You should get up.
How are you feeling, baby?
Come on.
I know you're sleepy but I need you to get up so I can get a look at you and take your temperature.
translation.ko: 졸려도 일어나봐 괜찮은지 체온 좀 재보자

translation.en: You were pretty warm last night.
Well, you're not so warm now.
Yay.
Does your throat hurt?
-No. -Good.
What is that? Blood, is that blood?
translation.ko: 왜 그래, 피 나? 피 나니?

translation.en: What are you--
What are you--
What are you fucking doing?
What the fuck? Are those your teeth?
Archie.
Stop doing that. Clay!
My teeth.
[Amanda] Clay!
What's happening to me?
[Amanda] Clay!
[Clay] Is everything okay?
-Something's wrong with Archie. -What is it? What the fuck?
translation.ko: - 얘가 이상해 - 왜? 이게 무슨 일이야?

translation.en: -That's exactly what I said. -My teeth just, they felt weird.
translation.ko: 내 말이! 이가 흔들리는 거 같아서

translation.en: And I touched them, and they just they fell out.
He was a little warm last night but this, I don't know.
Okay, all right. Well you-- you're okay.
I don't feel okay.
How are you feeling?
Besides your teeth falling out, I mean.
What kind of question is that? He's obviously sick.
translation.ko: 무슨 질문이 그래? 아픈 거 안 보여?

translation.en: I'm not sick, Mom. My teeth just fell out.
translation.ko: 나 안 아파요 그냥 이빨이 빠진 거예요

translation.en: Maybe it was the bug that bit me. I don't know.
What bug?
A bug bit me yesterday in the woods.
[G.H.] That must be it, then.
Probably just a tick, Lyme disease. I've seen stranger symptoms.
translation.ko: 진드기 라임병 증상 중에 별 이상한 게 많아

translation.en: Stranger than this?
He needs to go to the emergency room. We need to go to the hospital.
translation.ko: 얘 지금 당장 응급실에 가야 해요

translation.en: We can't. The expressway's the only way out of town.
Besides, if the roads are jammed, no one would be there to help us anyway.
translation.ko: 길이 막혔다면 가봤자 아무도 없을 거고요

translation.en: Well, we have to do something. Archie needs to see a doctor.
translation.ko: 뭐든 해봐야죠 얜 진료를 받아야 돼요

translation.en: [sighs] I can't believe this is happening. I can't believe this is happening.
translation.ko: 어떻게 이런 일이! 대체 이게 무슨 일이야

translation.en: We'll go to my contractor's house. He's not that far from here.
translation.ko: 인테리어 업자 집으로 갑시다 여기서 가까워요

translation.en: You said you saw him stocking up on supplies?
If I know Danny, he's prepared for anything. He might have something useful.
Antibiotics, medicine. Danny'll know what to do.
translation.ko: 항생제랑 필요한 팁을 얻을 수 있을 거예요

translation.en: Hey.
I promise you, I'll get your son some help.
Where's Rose?
I couldn't find her.
What? What does that mean?
I looked all over the house. She's not here.
-She's not in the backyard. -I'll look downstairs.
translation.ko: 뒷마당에도 없어 아래층에서 집 구경 중일지도 몰라요

translation.en: She's probably exploring the house.
She might be playing outside. I'll look out for her.
I looked there but feel free to check again.
I don't understand. Where is she?
-She has to be here somewhere. -No, she's not!
translation.ko: 이상하네, 애가 어딜 가? 이 주변엔 없다고! 다 찾아봤는데 없어

translation.en: I'm telling you, I have looked everywhere and she's not here.
translation.ko: 이 주변엔 없다고! 다 찾아봤는데 없어

translation.en: -Well, she should be in the garage. -I already looked in the garage.
translation.ko: - 차고에 있는 거 아냐? - 거기도 가 봤어

translation.en: Okay. Where the fuck haven't you looked, Clay?
translation.ko: 안 찾아본 데도 있을 거 아냐?

translation.en: She's not down there.
Okay, this is insane. Where is she?
She wasn't outside,
but I think she may have taken one of the bikes from the garage.
Took one of the bikes? Where would she go?
Do you have any idea where your sister might be, bud?
I don't know. Um, we were out by the shed yesterday, so--
translation.ko: 없어요, 어제 헛간 근처에 가긴 했는데…

translation.en: The shed? What shed?
The-- the shed.
Um, she-- she saw some deer and she wanted to go look for them.
translation.ko: 사슴을 찾는다고 거기 갔었는데 어쩌면 지금 거기…

translation.en: -So maybe there. I don't know. -Okay, I'm going.
translation.ko: 사슴을 찾는다고 거기 갔었는데 어쩌면 지금 거기… 내가 가볼게

translation.en: -[Archie retches] -Archie, you all right?
-[Archie grunts and moans] -Are you all right--
-[G.H.] He needs help now. -[Clay] Yeah, okay.
-Okay, I got you. -[Ruth] I'm coming with you.
[G.H.] No, it's not safe.
Stay here with Amanda. Find Rose.
translation.ko: 넌 아만다와 여기 있어 로즈도 찾아보고

translation.en: No. What? You can't leave me here by myself.
-It'll be okay. -Dad, we talked about this.
translation.ko: 별일 없을 거야 약속했잖아요 나 혼자 여기 두지 않기로!

translation.en: You cannot leave me here by myself.
translation.ko: 약속했잖아요 나 혼자 여기 두지 않기로!

translation.en: -He's sick, don't you see that? -Dad, you will never come back.
translation.ko: 쟤 아픈 거 안 보여? 가면 영영 못 와요

translation.en: Don't you see that something is happening? It is happening right now.
translation.ko: 지금 무슨 일이 벌어지고 있다고요, 바로 지금

translation.en: Whatever it is, it's happening to Archie, it's happening to all of us.
You can't leave. The world could be ending out there.
translation.ko: 나가면 안 돼요 세상이 끝났을지도 몰라요

translation.en: That's why I want you here.
Take out your phone.
Come on, take it out.
Set a timer, one hour.
I'll be back.
It won't work.
It won't work out.
It will, there's no choice.
Look, I'll be back for you before this goes off.
translation.ko: 알람이 울리기 전에 꼭 데리러 올게

translation.en: One hour. That's what you get. You've promised.
translation.ko: 한 시간이에요 그 안에 꼭 와야 돼요

translation.en: [echoing] Rose? Rose!
Rosie! Rose!
[Amanda] This is a nightmare.
This is a goddamn nightmare.
Where would Rose have gone? Why would she leave?
translation.ko: 얘가 어딜 간 걸까? 왜 나간 거지?

translation.en: She said she was done waiting. What did she mean?
What if we just went back to the house and we waited for my dad to get back?
translation.ko: 집에 가서 우리 아빠를 기다리는 게 어때요?

translation.en: And then what?
He'll find Rose?
I don't know, but he will help us.
I just want to know what the fuck is happening.
translation.ko: 난 이 상황이 뭔지 알고 싶어

translation.en: I want to know what the fuck is the plan.
I want to know that we can find my kid and then get in your fucking expensive car
translation.ko: 내 딸을 찾아서 너희 비싼 차에 다 함께 타고

translation.en: and drive to an actual hospital, find a doctor who will tell me
translation.ko: 병원 가서 내 아들 진료 받고

translation.en: that my baby is okay, that we're all gonna be okay,
and then we can just all go back to our house.
translation.ko: 집에 갈 수 있는지 알고 싶다고!

translation.en: What if that's not possible?
I want to get the fuck away from here, and you, and whatever is happening.
translation.ko: 난 빨리 이곳과 너와 이 상황에서 벗어나고 싶어

translation.en: It's happening to all of us.
I know that it is happening to all of us!
translation.ko: 모두가 겪는 일인 거 나도 알아!

translation.en: Stop yelling at me!
You don't care.
You don't care that I'm here.
And my mom is probably at the bottom of some ocean.
translation.ko: 우리 엄만 바다 밑에 가라앉았을지도 몰라요

translation.en: I don't have anyone else in my life.
I have nothing to go home to but them. Do you understand that?
translation.ko: 세상에 엄마 아빠뿐이라고요 그 마음 알아요?

translation.en: And I need my mom more than ever.
translation.ko: 난 지금 그 어느 때보다 엄마가 필요해요

translation.en: And I will probably never see her again.
translation.ko: 근데 다신 엄마를 볼 수 없겠죠

translation.en: I care, I do.
I don't know what I'm supposed to do about that, but I do care.
translation.ko: 표현하는 방법을 모를 뿐 관심은 있다고

translation.en: Why are you like this?
What do you get out of being so angry all the time?
translation.ko: 늘 그렇게 화를 내서 얻는 게 뭐죠?

translation.en: Every day, all day, my job-- my whole job is to…
translation.ko: 매일 내가 하는 일은 사람의 심리를 읽는 거야

translation.en: …understand people well enough so that I know how to lie to them,
translation.ko: 상대를 잘 알아야 거짓말을 잘할 수 있고

translation.en: so I can sell them things they don't really want.
translation.ko: 필요 없는 물건을 팔아먹을 수 있거든

translation.en: And when you study people like that,
when you really see the way they treat each other, well…
You're no dummy.
You see what they do, and they do it without even thinking about it.
Fuck. I did it to you and your dad, and I don't even really know why.
translation.ko: 근데 내가 너와 네 아빠를 그렇게 대했어

translation.en: We fuck each other over
all the time, without even realizing it.
We fuck every living thing on this planet over and think it'll be fine
translation.ko: 세상 모든 생명에게 상처를 줘 그리고

translation.en: because we use paper straws and order the free range chicken.
translation.ko: 종이 빨대와 동물복지 제품을 쓰며 죄책감을 잊지

translation.en: And the sick thing is, I think deep down we know we're not fooling anyone.
translation.ko: 웃기는 건 다들 속으론 알고 있다는 거야

translation.en: I think we know we're living a lie.
An agreed upon mass delusion
to help us ignore and keep ignoring how awful we really are.
translation.ko: 자신들의 끔찍한 실체를 외면하고 있다는 걸

translation.en: I'm not down with most of the things that you do and say, but…
translation.ko: 평소엔 아줌마의 언행이 다 마음에 안 들지만

translation.en: …this is the part of the Venn diagram where we overlap.
I agree with everything you just said.
But as awful as people might be…
translation.ko: 하지만 인간이 아무리 끔찍한 존재라 해도

translation.en: …nothing's gonna change the fact that we are all we've got.
I don't want to be this way.
I hate being terrible like this.
And I know I say I hate people, but I…
I'd do anything to have them back.
[Archie] Hey, Dad.
Do you think Taylor's okay?
Who?
Archie, you stay here.
Let's go.
George.
Danny. Sorry to bother you at home like this.
I'm gonna need you and your comrade to step off the porch
and stand by your vehicle.
What?
Off the porch and by your vehicle.
What can I do for you?
We're just checking on you.
Seeing if you're here, if you're okay.
If you heard anything about what's going on.
Yeah, I'm Clay.
My family rented G.H.'s-- George's home, you know.
translation.ko: 저희 가족이 G.H.… 조지의 집을 빌렸거든요

translation.en: We're from the city.
Well, that's a lucky break for your family.
Imagine what a shit show the city must be right now.
I got to be honest with you, I'm surprised you guys are even out.
We came out here because my son needs help.
He's vomiting. He's--
He's lost his teeth. They just fell out. Can't explain it.
Oh. His teeth, huh?
Well, it's gotta have something to do with that noise.
You know something about the noise?
translation.ko: 그 굉음에 대해 아는 거 있어요?

translation.en: Well, it's not all that dissimilar to what happened in Cuba a while back.
translation.ko: 지금 상황과 비슷했던 얼마 전의 쿠바 사태 때

translation.en: Microwave weapons, they call it, produces a kind of radiation
that can be beamed out through sound.
Some people lost their teeth there too.
Outside of that, the only thing I know for sure is
there's not a lot of information getting out, so…
I assume it's a war.
The beginning of one, anyways.
They've been saying there was chatter.
This has to be what they were chattering about.
Chatter, what do you mean, "chatter"?
You got to read the papers deeper than page one.
The Russians recalled their staff from Washington.
Did you even notice that?
Something is afoot. Now, what that is exactly, I don't know.
translation.ko: 어쨌든 뭔가 터졌는데 그게 뭔진 모르겠어요

translation.en: Maybe this is as much as we're ever going to know.
Maybe we just need to sit tight, be safe.
Pray. Whatever works for you.
Well, Danny.
It's like Clay said, his son isn't well.
We're gonna need more than just prayers.
And knowing how primed you are for these kind of situations,
we're thinking you might have some medicine that'd be able to help him.
translation.ko: 도움이 될 약이 있을 거 같은데

translation.en: What I got isn't your business.
Danny.
Come on now, it's me. We know each other.
We're friends.
That's the old way, George. You're not thinking clearly.
translation.ko: 그건 옛날 얘기죠, 조지 아직 뭘 모르시네

translation.en: Danny, what are you saying?
You're telling this man not to take care of his son?
Nothing makes a whole lot of sense right now.
When the world doesn't make any sense, I can still do what's rational,
which is protect my own.
What you do is your business.
translation.ko: 당신들 사정은 내 알 바 아니라고

translation.en: I thought I was doing the right thing by bringing them here.
translation.ko: 쟬 이리 데려오는 게 최선이라 생각했소

translation.en: Now if you have some medicine that can help him--
We can pay.
Say, a thousand dollars?
Cash might not mean much if the government falls.
Well, the whole network's down. My credit cards aren't going to work.
translation.ko: 전산망 마비로 신용카드는 안 될 거예요

translation.en: There's no Venmo or ApplePay.
I mean, cash might be the only thing that means something.
My son's really sick. He needs your help. He's 16 years old.
translation.ko: 제 아들이 많이 아파요 지금 겨우 16살입니다

translation.en: Nothing's here.
Rosie.
[Danny] You're in a difficult position.
I get it.
I would do anything I had to for my family.
translation.ko: 나라도 가족을 위해선 뭐든 할 거예요

translation.en: So that's what I'm doing.
I'm locking the doors. I'm waiting, I'm watching,
I'm getting out my gun.
Other than that, I don't have any answers for you.
translation.ko: 그 외엔 더 대답할 말이 없네요

translation.en: Ruth, it's bike tracks--
I'm going to go back inside my house now.
I'm gonna say goodbye and good luck.
You come out again, you're welcome to stop by,
but I can't offer you much more than conversation.
translation.ko: 난 이런 말 외엔 해줄 게 없어요

translation.en: I suggest you try your neighbors, the Thornes.
They did a basement conversion
on the down-low a while back, no permits or nothing.
A buddy of mine worked on it. He wouldn't even show me the plans.
translation.ko: 시공한 내 친구가 설계도도 안 보여줍디다

translation.en: Now, you ask me?
That's rich asshole talk for doomsday bunker.
Come on, Danny. You can't desert us like this.
Haven't you been picking up on what's going on out there, George?
translation.ko: 세상이 어떻게 돌아가는지 아직도 감이 안 와요, 조지?

translation.en: We've all been deserted.
[Danny] All due respect.
I would like all of you off of my property.
Now.
We're not going anywhere till you give us what we need.
translation.ko: 필요한 걸 받기 전엔 아무 데도 못 가요

translation.en: [Clay yelling] What the fuck is going on right now?
I promised this boy's mother I'd get him some help.
The only thing you're helping him to is a quick death
-unless you lower your weapons. -G.H., put the gun down.
translation.ko: 쟤 명만 단축돼 총 내려요, 병원 가는 딴 길을 찾아봅시다

translation.en: -We'll find another way to the hospital. -There is no other way!
translation.ko: 총 내려요, 병원 가는 딴 길을 찾아봅시다 딴 길은 없어요! 저 자는 우릴 못 쏠 거고

translation.en: Besides, he's not gonna shoot us.
translation.ko: 딴 길은 없어요! 저 자는 우릴 못 쏠 거고

translation.en: Uh… It sounds like he's gonna shoot us.
-I'm telling you he's bluffing. -The fuck I am.
Hold-- Hold on! Hold on!
-Clay, get out of the way! -Dad!
I'm trying to reason with him!
The only way this ends
is if you get back in your vehicle and drive away now.
translation.ko: 당신들이 저 차 타고 당장 떠나는 거야

translation.en: Drive away to what? All the roads are blocked.
We're in the middle of God-knows-where. There's no one else around.
translation.ko: 이 근처엔 사람 한 명 안 다녀요

translation.en: I have no idea what I am supposed to do right now.
I can barely do anything without my cell phone and my GPS.
translation.ko: 난 폰과 GPS 없인 아무것도 못 하는

translation.en: I am a useless man.
But my son is sick.
And my daughter is missing.
And I don't know what to do.
But you are a very prepared man.
translation.ko: 하지만 당신은 만반의 준비가 된 사람이잖아요

translation.en: Fuck yeah, I am.
That's right, that's why we came to you,
because you're the only one who can help my son.
-Not my problem. -No, you're right. It's not.
translation.ko: - 내 알 바 아냐 - 네, 물론 그렇죠

translation.en: But it's like you said, right?
What would you do if it was your family? That's what I'm doing.
translation.ko: 가족을 위해선 뭐든 한다고! 나도 그래요

translation.en: It's the only thing I can do.
I am begging you.
Please.
Please help my son.
I guess an old fashioned barter system was to be expected at some point.
translation.ko: 내 언젠간 물물교환 시대가 다시 올 줄 알았지

translation.en: It's still cash, so it's not really a barter system.
[Danny] Hey, I got another tidbit for you.
Free of charge, if you want it.
It's the Koreans behind all this.
Koreans?
What makes you say that?
Just trust me. It's the Koreans. Or the Chinese. One of them.
Show him.
I was driving around yesterday.
There's a big drone dropping these everywhere.
It means "Death to America," so we're thinking Iranians.
translation.ko: '미국에 죽음을'이라는 내용을 봐선 이란 짓 같아요

translation.en: I remember hearing something on NPR once about their cyber capabilities.
translation.ko: 이란의 사이버 테러에 대한 방송도 들은 적 있어요

translation.en: Why is that funny?
Before the phones went out,
I heard from a friend of mine in San Diego about a similar event,
translation.ko: 샌디에이고의 친구가 이런 걸 주웠다고 했는데

translation.en: drones dropping pamphlets except they were in Korean.
Or Mandarin. Like I said, he couldn't tell which.
translation.ko: 아니면 중국말 그는 구분을 못 하니까

translation.en: But seeing as he did four tours in Iraq,
translation.ko: 하지만 이라크에 네 번 참전했던 친구라

translation.en: he sure as shit would have known if it looked like that.
translation.ko: 그 지역 글자라면 몰라봤을 리가 없죠

translation.en: We made a lot of enemies around the world.
Maybe all this means is a few of them teamed up.
translation.ko: 그중 몇이 동맹을 맺었을 수도 있지

translation.en: I saw flamingos in our pool last night.
The animals, they're trying to warn us.
They know something.
They know something that we don't.
It's like when dogs know storms are coming.
There's more bike tracks up ahead.
translation.ko: 저 앞에 자전거 바퀴 자국이 많네

translation.en: We should go back to the house. My dad is probably there.
Maybe he can help… us.
I'm not going anywhere without Rosie.
translation.ko: 로지를 두곤 아무 데도 안 가

translation.en: That house. That's gotta be where she went.
translation.ko: 저 집 저 집에 들어갔나 봐

translation.en: All right, let's go back and see if they found Rose.
G.H., what's going on?
Before we go…
I need to know that you're on the level with me.
translation.ko: 당신이 숨기는 게 없는지 알고 싶어요

translation.en: No matter how far this thing goes, I need to know that we're good
because if what just happened here is happening everywhere,
translation.ko: 이런 일이 모든 곳에서 벌어지고 있다면

translation.en: we need to get to that bunker Danny told us about, and we need to get there now.
translation.ko: 대니가 말한 지하 벙커로 당장 가야 돼요

translation.en: What are you talking about?
You know something.
I had a sneaking suspicion, but I wanted more information first.
All signs were there, sure, but I…
I didn't want to scare anyone.
You'd have called me crazy because it is crazy.
It would have made more sense if we were on the brink of an all-out invasion,
but this…
I didn't think we'd actually let something like this happen.
translation.ko: 난 우리가 이런 일을 당할 만큼

translation.en: I thought we were smarter than that.
Let what happen?
Because my primary client works in the defense sector,
I spend a lot of time studying the cost benefit analysis of military campaigns.
translation.ko: 난 군사작전의 가성비 분석 작업을 많이 하죠

translation.en: There was one program in particular that terrified my client the most.
translation.ko: 근데 그가 두려워했던 프로그램이 하나 있었어요

translation.en: A simple three-stage maneuver that could topple a country's government from within.
translation.ko: 한 정부를 내부에서 무너뜨릴 수 있는 3단계 작전

translation.en: The first stage is isolation.
Disable their communication and transportation.
Make the target as deaf, dumb and paralyzed as possible,
translation.ko: 표적의 눈과 귀를 최대한 가린 뒤

translation.en: setting them up for the second stage.
Synchronized chaos.
Terrorize them with covert attacks and misinformation,
overwhelming their defense capabilities
leaving their weapon systems vulnerable to extremists and their own military.
translation.ko: 내란과 쿠데타에 무방비가 되게 만드는 거예요

translation.en: Without a clear enemy or motive, people would start turning on each other.
translation.ko: 사람들은 적이나 동기가 불분명하면 서로를 공격하죠

translation.en: If done successfully, the third stage would happen on its own.
What's the third stage?
Coup d'état.
Civil war.
Collapse.
This program was considered the most cost-effective way
to destabilize a country.
Because if the target nation was dysfunctional enough,
it would, in essence, do the work for you.
Whoever started this wants us to finish it.
[Amanda, faint] Rose!
